text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Agent" means a pharmacy, a pharmacist, a mail order pharmacy, or a nonresident pharmacy acting on behalf or at the direction of a pharmacy benefits manager.
"Beneficiary" means an individual who receives prescription drug coverage or benefits from a purchaser.
"ERISA" has the meaning stated in § 8-301 of this article.
"Formulary" means a list of prescription drugs used by a purchaser.

section.section: "Manufacturer payments" means any compensation or remuneration a pharmacy benefits manager receives from or on behalf of a pharmaceutical manufacturer.
"Manufacturer payments" does not include purchase discounts based on invoiced purchase terms.

text.section: "Nonprofit health maintenance organization" has the meaning stated in § 6-121(a) of this article.
"Nonresident pharmacy" has the meaning stated in § 12-403 of the Health Occupations Article.
"Pharmacist" has the meaning stated in § 12-101 of the Health Occupations Article.
"Pharmacy" has the meaning stated in § 12-101 of the Health Occupations Article.

"Pharmacy and therapeutics committee" means a committee established by a pharmacy benefits manager to:
objectively appraise and evaluate prescription drugs; and
make recommendations to a purchaser regarding the selection of drugs for the purchaser's formulary.

section.section:
"Pharmacy benefits management services" means:
the procurement of prescription drugs at a negotiated rate for dispensation within the State to beneficiaries;
the administration or management of prescription drug coverage provided by a purchaser for beneficiaries; and
any of the following services provided with regard to the administration of prescription drug coverage:

"Pharmacy benefits management services" does not include any service provided by a nonprofit health maintenance organization that operates as a group model, provided that the service:
is provided solely to a member of the nonprofit health maintenance organization; and
is furnished through the internal pharmacy operations of the nonprofit health maintenance organization.

text.section: "Pharmacy benefits manager" means a person that performs pharmacy benefits management services.

"Proprietary information" means:
a trade secret;
confidential commercial information; or
confidential financial information.

section.section:
"Purchaser" means the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program, an insurer, a nonprofit health service plan, or a health maintenance organization that:
provides prescription drug coverage or benefits in the State; and
enters into an agreement with a pharmacy benefits manager for the provision of pharmacy benefits management services.

"Purchaser" does not include a person that provides prescription drug coverage or benefits through plans subject to ERISA and does not provide prescription drug coverage or benefits through insurance, unless the person is a multiple employer welfare arrangement as defined in § 514(b)(6)(a)(ii) of ERISA.

text.section: "Rebate sharing contract" means a contract between a pharmacy benefits manager and a purchaser under which the pharmacy benefits manager agrees to share manufacturer payments with the purchaser.

section.section: "Therapeutic interchange" means any change from one prescription drug to another.

text.section: "Therapeutic interchange solicitation" means any communication by a pharmacy benefits manager for the purpose of requesting a therapeutic interchange.
"Trade secret" has the meaning stated in § 11-1201 of the Commercial Law Article.
